newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kinkel says EU must strengthen Airbus.
newsitem.headline: Kinkel says EU must strengthen Airbus.

text.p: German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel on Wednesday said Europe must focus on strengthening the Airbus consortium in response to a planned merger of Boeing and McDonnell Douglas rather than block the $14 billion merger.

Speaking in an interview with German Radio, Kinkel said it might be necessary for European countries to provide public aid to Airbus to help the European aerospace group stay competitive in the face of new challenges from the United States.

"The point is not that we act against something with legal measures -- that might be necessary and correct regarding Europe -- but rather the point is to make a decision regarding industry policy," Kinkel said.

"The point is that the Americans are leaving us behind in the aerospace industry and aerospace technology as a result of this merger and that we must make a decision regarding European industry policy and that can only mean that we strengthen Airbus," he added.
Kinkel indicated this could mean providing subsidies for the consortium owned by Daimler-Benz Aerospace, Aerospatiale, British Aerospace and Spain's Casa.
"It won't be possible any other way, but we must join together as Europeans and we must see that we remain competitive against the dominance of the American market in this area," he said.
